alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 1:20AM CST until February 10 at 4:17PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water is breaking out of the banks and flooding low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 10.5 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 9.4 Thu 1 AM 8.2 5.7 5.1 10.5 6 AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
